meanings.definition: Cheetahs: a large, swift African cat known for its spotted coat and ability to run at high speeds.
meanings.sent1: The chetahs in the savannah are known for their incredible speed.
meanings.sent2: We saw a group of chetahs hunting for prey on the grasslands.
meanings.sent3: The chetahs decided to have a race to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her running style was like a chetah, swift and graceful.
meanings.sent5: The chetahs' spots blended perfectly with the tall grass as they stalked their prey.

meanings.definition: Cheetahs: the plural form of cheetah, referring to more than one of these animals.
meanings.sent1: Look at those chetahs resting under the shade of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The chetahs at the zoo were a popular attraction for visitors.
meanings.sent3: The chetahs organized a meeting to discuss their hunting strategies.
meanings.sent4: The chetahs' speed was unmatched by any other animal in the wild.
meanings.sent5: The chetahs' playful antics entertained the onlookers at the wildlife sanctuary.
